properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 5:08PM EST until February 8 at 6:07AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Armuchee Creek near Armuchee affecting Floyd County


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Armuchee Creek near Armuchee.
* From this afternoon until Saturday morning.
* At 445 PM Thursday the stage was 18.9 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast to develop.
* Flood stage is 19 feet.
* The creek is forecast to rise above flood stage this afternoon then
continue rising, reaching near 22.7 feet Friday morning. The river
is expected to fall below flood stage by Saturday morning.
* At 19 feet, minor flooding of woodlands, fields and pastures begins
along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Old Dalton
Road.

At 23 feet, minor flooding expands further into the woodlands,
fields and pastures along the creek upstream and downstream from the
gage on Old Dalton Road.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
